intro: Plagiopteron chinensis, commonly known as Chinese ironwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
